description: Defines the RequestHandler class, which manages lifecycle-related operations such as launch, terminate, sendIntent, and updateState. Includes references to runtime and window managers and an event handler within the WPEFramework plugin namespace.

classes.name: RequestHandler
classes.description: Manages lifecycle operations for plugins, providing methods for launching, terminating, sending intents, and updating state. Implements singleton pattern and holds references to runtime, window, and event handlers.

methods.name: RequestHandler(const RequestHandler& obj) = delete
methods.description: Deleted copy constructor to prevent copying of singleton instance.

methods.name: static RequestHandler* getInstance()
methods.description: Provides access to the singleton instance of RequestHandler.

methods.name: bool initialize(PluginHost::IShell* service, IEventHandler* eventHandler)
methods.description: Initializes the RequestHandler with service and event handler references.

methods.name: void terminate()
methods.description: Cleans up and terminates the RequestHandler.

methods.name: bool launch(ApplicationContext* context, const string& launchIntent, const Exchange::ILifecycleManager::LifecycleState targetLifecycleState, string& errorReason)
methods.description: Launches a plugin with specified intent and target lifecycle state.

methods.name: bool terminate(ApplicationContext* context, bool force, string& errorReason)
methods.description: Terminates a plugin, optionally forcing termination.

methods.name: bool sendIntent(ApplicationContext* context, const string& intent, string& errorReason)
methods.description: Sends an intent to the plugin.

methods.name: bool updateState(ApplicationContext* context, Exchange::ILifecycleManager::LifecycleState targetLifecycleState, string& errorReason)
methods.description: Updates the lifecycle state of a plugin.

methods.name: RuntimeManagerHandler* getRuntimeManagerHandler()
methods.description: Returns a pointer to the RuntimeManagerHandler.

methods.name: WindowManagerHandler* getWindowManagerHandler()
methods.description: Returns a pointer to the WindowManagerHandler.

methods.name: IEventHandler* getEventHandler()
methods.description: Returns a pointer to the IEventHandler.
